channel.title: review on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in review on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Alien Covenant spoilers
item.description: 23:54 Friday 20 October 2017 JST The human story was fine but the science included a lot of … fiction. I saw the ending coming a mile away even though at the very end I second guessed my correct original guess. Holy cats they threw away a lot of equipment to kill one little monster. Why would that couple hook up after having apparently been so focused on their just deceased partners?

item.title: review for airbnb
item.description: 10:27 Saturday 05 August 2017 JST Huge Japanese home next to parks & hot springs (https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/17957650) is probably ideal for couples, but not big groups. Maybe it’s because we tried to do too much, or because Dr Wada was overbooked, and did not keep to the originally planned schedule. It’s all very confusing, actually, but in short, I do not recommend bringing big groups to this location. (( About a week before the weekend, my co-coordinator tried to get a group discount for having invited / brought so many (14+) people.

item.title: Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency on Netflix
item.description: 09:51 Wednesday 14 December 2016 JST Great show! My favorite character (after 3 episodes) is Bart. “There’s only 2 universal constants..”

item.title: movie The Magic of Belle Isle
item.description: 00:26 Thursday 03 November 2016 JST Lin and I watched The Magic of Belle Isle on Netflix tonight; it was lovely and touching. I didn’t like the grouchy characters at first, but the character arcs were beautiful. Yes, it’s a simple story on the surface, but it’s got stories within stories and layers upon layers.

item.title: book review The Last
item.description: 17:45 Sunday 03 May 2015 JST I just finished Mike’s latest book, The Last. It’s a really interesting story set in the real world, just three years from now. Quite an easy read except for the queasy parts which I almost had to put down! The story leaves some unanswered questions, and lends itself to more books, which I hope he writes soon! I was surprised by the plot twists; it seemed so simple at first!
